text.value: Now lets make a Merkle Tree. Take 'File A' from question 1, then add some more files. The hashes for these files have already been filled out. Then we add the hashes together (in the real world they might be concatenated). Finally hash the combined value to get the top level hash for the tree. (You can see that file A and file B have already been combined into a subtree, just add the top of that tree with the hash values from the other files and hash them all together).
Add the hashes together and square root them.
